page.title: 16HOME LIFE-THEN AND NOW.
page.content: {GREAT GRANDMOTHER'S HARD DAY.(l900-14) Her gruelling day began before five. Hours spent on firelighting, bread- baking and staggered meals for her six sons down to the baby.Shopping,washing with tub,"poss stick" and heavy wooden mangle,ironing with flat-iron,cleaning finally bathing husband and eldest son on their return from pit. {G.Smith. {MOTHER'S DAY 1985. } Mum loads the automatic washer with dirty clothes. They are soon clean and transferred to the rumbling, vibrating tumble drier. Meanwhile,Mum pre-records a TV film on video.Fridge ingredients are fed into the cake-mixer. Whirring,bubbling,they blend together. She pops a snack into the toaster and the cake into the microwave oven.A bell rings signifying the cake is done. "How's your day been?" I ask. "Oh, a woman's work is never done!" Mum replies. {S.Nield.
